result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua James Robel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua James Robel

records.addlTxt: 10:17 AM Defendant Joshua James Robel in court.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State moves to remove repeater enhancer.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended Ct.1.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended Ct.1. State gives sentence recommendation, makes statement. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond no longer in effect.
Status conference on August 18, 2022 at 10:20 am.

10:00 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua James Robel in court. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:20 am.
No contact direct or indirect with M.A.M, residence or place of employment.
No contact direct or indirect with M.A.M., her residence or place of employment.

1:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Joshua James Robel appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
